briefdescription.para: Creates a new instance of the class with the default property values.

detaileddescription.para:
The fraction of observations per tree
:expr:observations_per_tree_fraction > 0.0
:expr:observations_per_tree_fraction <= 1.0
default = 1.0

The impurity threshold, a node will be split if this split induces a decrease of the impurity greater than or equal to the input value
:expr:impurity_threshold >= 0.0
default = 0.0

The min weight fraction in a leaf node. The minimum weighted fraction of the total sum of weights (of all input observations) required to be at a leaf node
:expr:min_weight_fraction_in_leaf_node >= 0.0
:expr:min_weight_fraction_in_leaf_node <= 0.5
default = 0.0

The min impurity decrease in a split node is a threshold for stopping the tree growth early. A node will be split if its impurity is above the threshold, otherwise it is a leaf.
:expr:min_impurity_decrease_in_split_node >= 0.0
default = 0.0

The number of trees in the forest.
:expr:tree_count > 0
default = 100

The number of features to consider when looking for the best split for a node.
default = task::classification ? sqrt(p) : p/3, where p is the total number of features

The maximal depth of the tree. If 0, then nodes are expanded until all leaves are pure or until all leaves contain less or equal to min observations in leaf node samples.
default = 0

The minimal number of observations in a leaf node.
:expr:min_observations_in_leaf_node > 0
default = 1 for classification, 5 for regression

The minimal number of observations in a split node.
:expr:min_observations_in_split_node > 1
default = 2

The maximal number of the leaf nodes. If 0, the number of leaf nodes is not limited.
default = 0

The maximal number of discrete bins to bucket continuous features. Used with :expr:method::hist split-finding method only. Increasing the number results in higher computation costs.
:expr:max_bins > 1
default = 256

The minimal number of observations in a bin. Used with :expr:method::hist split-finding method only.
:expr:min_bin_size > 0
default = 5

The memory saving mode.
default = false

The bootstrap mode, if true, the training set for a tree is a bootstrap of the whole training set, if False, the whole dataset is used to build each tree.
default = true

Splitter strategy: if 'best', best threshold for each is selected. If 'random', threshold is selected randomly.
default = splitter_mode::best

The error metric mode
default = error_metric_mode::none

The variable importance mode
default = variable_importance_mode::none

The class count. Used with :expr:task::classification only.
default = 2

briefdescription.para: The infer mode. Used with :expr:task::classification only.
The voting mode. Used with :expr:task::classification only.

detaileddescription.para:
Seed for the random numbers generator used by the algorithm
:expr:tree_count > 0

parameterdescription.para: The floating-point type that the algorithm uses for intermediate computations. Can be :expr:float or :expr:double.
Tag-type that specifies an implementation of algorithm. Can be :expr:method::dense or :expr:method::hist.
Tag-type that specifies type of the problem to solve. Can be :expr:task::classification or :expr:task::regression.
